claim: Barack Obama was the first African American president of the United States.
evidence: Barack Obama served as the 44th President of the United States from 2009 to 2017.
Barack Obama is of African American heritage.
No previous U.S. president was of African American descent before Obama.
label: True

claim: Albert Einstein developed the theory of relativity and won the Nobel Prize for it.
evidence: Albert Einstein developed the special theory of relativity in 1905 and general theory of relativity in 1915.
Einstein won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
Einstein's Nobel Prize was awarded for his explanation of the photoelectric effect, not for relativity theory.
label: False

claim: The founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, dropped out of Harvard University.
evidence: Bill Gates co-founded Microsoft in 1975.
Bill Gates attended Harvard University from 1973 to 1975.
Gates left Harvard during his sophomore year to focus on Microsoft.
Harvard University is located in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
label: True

claim: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France and stands on Liberty Island in New York Harbor.
evidence: The Statue of Liberty was dedicated on October 28, 1886.
The statue was designed by French sculptor Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi.
France presented the statue to the United States as a gift for the centennial of American independence.
Liberty Island is located in New York Harbor between Manhattan and Staten Island.
label: True

claim: Shakespeare wrote Romeo and Juliet in the 16th century and it is set in London.
evidence: William Shakespeare wrote Romeo and Juliet around 1594-1596.
The 16th century spans from 1501 to 1600.
Romeo and Juliet is set in Verona, Italy, not London.
Shakespeare was born in Stratford-upon-Avon, England.
label: False

claim: The Great Wall of China was built by Emperor Qin Shi Huang and is visible from space.
evidence: Emperor Qin Shi Huang ordered the construction of the Great Wall around 220-210 BC.
The Great Wall was built by connecting and extending existing walls built by warring states.
NASA has confirmed that the Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
The wall is approximately 13,000 miles long.
label: False

claim: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and she won it in Chemistry.
evidence: Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1903, shared with Pierre Curie and Henri Becquerel.
Marie Curie won a second Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1911.
Marie Curie was indeed the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.
She remains the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields.
label: False

claim: The capital of Australia is Sydney and it is the largest city in the country.
evidence: The capital of Australia is Canberra, not Sydney.
Canberra was established as the capital in 1913.
Sydney is the largest city in Australia by population.
Sydney is located in New South Wales and is a major economic center.
label: False

claim: Amazon rainforest is located in South America and is often called the lungs of the Earth.
evidence: The Amazon rainforest spans across nine countries in South America.
Brazil contains about 60% of the Amazon rainforest.
The Amazon produces about 20% of the world's oxygen.
It is often referred to as the 'lungs of the Earth' due to its role in oxygen production.
label: True

claim: The iPhone was first released by Apple in 2007 and Steve Jobs was the CEO at that time.
evidence: The first iPhone was announced by Apple on January 9, 2007.
The iPhone went on sale to the public on June 29, 2007.
Steve Jobs was the CEO of Apple from 1997 until his resignation in August 2011.
Steve Jobs personally unveiled the iPhone at the Macworld Conference & Expo.
label: True
